text:
e="preserve">In cryptography, the Secure Hashing Algorithms are a group of cryptographic hash functions released by the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST). The algorithms take an input and produce a "hash" value (often shown in hexadecimal). The length of the "hash" depends on the digest length of the algorithm.
Family.
The Secure Hashing Algorithms, being Federal Information Processing Standard (FIPS) compliant algorithms are subject to the Cryptographic Algorithm Validation Program

annotations.surface_form: National Institute of Standards and Technology
